definition: music/rhyme and rhythm/initial, 音[yin1], and final and tone, 韻|韵[yun4], of a Chinese character/phoneme
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
the final (of a syllable) (Chinese phonology)/rhyme/appeal/charm/(literary) pleasant sound
Chinese phonetics (concerned also with rhyme in poetry)

sentences.english: Studies on historical phonetic change of Chinese is traditionally called Chinese phonology in China.
sentences.chinese: 漢語歷史語音變化的研究，在我國傳統稱爲音韻學。

sentences.english: Amy: Agreed. And we'll use mellifluous tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 同意，明天用“音韻優美”這個詞。

sentences.english: On rhyme, the two languages find their different ways in making musical effects.
sentences.chinese: 從音韻上講，漢詩和英詩壓韻的方法有很大區別。

sentences.english: Nothing can match the melody and fragrance of these poems on this beautiful occasion.
sentences.chinese: 在這樣一個曼妙的場合，詩歌的音韻和魅力是最強的。

sentences.english: The third part: the harmonious relation of Guanyang dialect" s initial consonants, vowels, tones."
sentences.chinese: 第四部分，灌陽方言的音韻特點。

sentences.english: Know what phonetics and phonology are and how language is acquired.
sentences.chinese: 瞭解音韻學以及語言的需求性。

sentences.english: Phonetic properties are cued by their graphological counterparts in written texts.
sentences.chinese: 音韻特性可以在不同地域的書面文本體現出來。

sentences.english: Furthermore, reading instruction and phonological awareness mutually reinforce each other.
sentences.chinese: 此外，閱讀教學和音韻意識互相促進。

sentences.english: Therefore, there are a number of branches of linguistics such as phonology, morphology, syntax, etc.
sentences.chinese: 因此，有很多分支語言學如音韻學，形態學，句法等。

sentences.english: This essay disposes of its six errors from the angle of phonology.
sentences.chinese: 從音韻學的角度清理其失誤，計有六處之多。

sentences.english: My spellbound heart has made and remade the necklace of songs
sentences.chinese: 我癡迷的心正再次爲你打造那串美妙音韻的項鍊。

sentences.english: This essay will disscuss sound of Dongkou County in Hunan Province that has the Gan dialect phonological characters.
sentences.chinese: 本文所描述的的對象是湖南省洞口縣的贛方言音韻。

sentences.english: There are 17 sounds whose phonological positions in Wang-san are different from those in Guang-yun.
sentences.chinese: 《王三》中有17個小韻與《廣韻》音韻地位不同。

sentences.english: Human languages share commonplace in function and it makes phonology transference possible.
sentences.chinese: 人類語言在功能上有相通之處，因而音韻可以翻譯。

sentences.english: It is academically recognized that there existed compound consonants in ancient Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 上古漢語存在複輔音，已爲歷史音韻學界共認。

sentences.english: Glottal stop did not exist according to the structure of original phonology in Japanese.
sentences.chinese: 根據日語原始的音韻結構，最先沒有促音。

definition: a transition (stop and change) in spoken sound, music or in brush strokes/a cadence/punctuated by a transition/with syncopated cadence (brush stroke in painting)
to express or convey one's ideas
see 頓挫抑揚|顿挫抑扬[dun4 cuo4 yi4 yang2]
to read aloud/to recite rhythmically/to chant/to intone (esp. poems in rhythm)
can be enjoyed by scholars and lay-people alike (idiom)
